xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 10 April 2013
xwikidoc.content: <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 01:15 <kushalkhandelwal> Hey 01:17 <sdumitriu> Hey kushalkhandelwal 01:18 <kushalkhandelwal> I was just going through the project ideas and found them very interesting 01:18 <kushalkhandelwal> How can i start contributing ? 01:18 <sdumitriu> Which ones did you like the most? 01:19 <kushalkhandelwal> and Visualization and analysis of patient data for the diagnosis of genetic disorders 01:19 <kushalkhandelwal> Some of the projects I like the most are " Hands-free (gesture and voice) interaction with PhenoTips " , "Real-time collection of clinical data on patients with genetic disorders using various medical ontologies" 01:20 <sdumitriu> OK, so PhenoTips 01:20 <sdumitriu> You can start at http://phenotips.org/Community/ 01:21 <kushalkhandelwal> And also "Form builder for PhenoTips" 01:21 <kushalkhandelwal> Will go through all the projects in detail 01:21 <kushalkhandelwal> Thank you sdumitriu :) 01:48 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 02:31 <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 05:43 <phd> has joined #ccm 10:00 <Shabbir> has joined #ccm 10:13 <phd> has joined #ccm 11:44 <phd> has joined #ccm 12:16 <phd> has joined #ccm 13:11 <laci_r> has left #ccm 13:33 <lacir> has joined #ccm 15:46 <phd> has joined #ccm 15:58 <orion__> has joined #ccm 17:26 <atyagi> has joined #ccm 20:20 <mehitabe1> I am thinking about the solr project and wondering if anyone can dive a little more into which packages would need the most work -- I am looking at org.ut.biolab.medsavant.server.serverapi, but where else? 20:21 <mehitabe1> if I want to walk through the life of a query in your system, where should I start? Still trying to understand the code 22:05 <lacir> Hi mehitabe1! The project coordinators are not here right now, so I emailed your question to Marc. He will get to you soon (tonight or tomorrow morning). 23:58 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm
